channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Fifth person who escaped from managed isolation in Hamilton detained
item.description: Four of the five people who absconded from a managed isolation facility in Hamilton last night will appear in court today - charged with breaching the Health Act.

item.title: Week in politics: A sense of fear in the corridors of power
item.description: A disgraced National MP resigns, a cabinet minister gets the sack, Winston Peters launches NZ First's campaign with an attack, and has to explain his friends' trip to Antarctica on the taxpayer.

item.title: 'We're excited' - Auckland family buy progressive ownership home
item.description: An Auckland family who are just months away from moving into a house bought through a shared ownership scheme say it has already drastically changed their lives.

item.title: Nine New Zealand cheeses recalled after listeria test
item.description: Talbot Forest Cheese said unconfirmed test results had indicated the presence of the bacteria in one of the products processed at the company's factory in Geraldine.

item.title: Five men arrested over sexual offending involving a minor
item.description: Five men have been arrested in Northland after an investigation into allegations of a sexual nature involving a minor.

item.title: Bad vibes: Rating political scandals by Twitter toxicity
item.description: As chaos swirled, the tweets got darker - but which day was peak bleak?

item.title: Otago University graduate raises $30k for mental health and suicide awareness
item.description: Just a little shy of 3000km and $30,000, Jono Hartland has put in a good effort.

item.title: Five people escape isolation facility in Hamilton
item.description: A 17-year-old man remains missing after he and four others escaped their isolation hotel in Hamilton tonight.

item.title: Police arrest man in Napier Mongrel Mob drug raid
item.description: A Napier man has been arrested after a search of two properties in the city found methamphetamine, cannabis and guns.

item.title: Sealord forfeits $16m vessel over Chatham Rise bottom trawling
item.description: New Zealand's largest fishing company Sealord has been ordered to forfeit a $16 million vessel and fined $24,000 for bottom trawling in a protected area.

item.title: Dedicated nurses for managed isolation 'ideal' - infection control expert
item.description: An infection prevention and control expert says in a perfect world a dedicated team of nurses would be caring for people in Covid-19 managed isolation and quarantine facilities.

item.title: NZ tempts Covid-19 fate by not introducing masks - researchers
item.description: New Zealand would have seen 990 to 4200 Covid-19 deaths if our losses matched OECD rates, but we're still tempting fate by not introducing masks, experts say.

item.title: Politicians, businesses back equal pay law change
item.description: Legislation passed last night empowering women to negotiate for pay equity is being called the biggest win for gender equality in nearly 40 years.

item.title: Ports of Auckland fined more than $420k after boat hit swimmer
item.description: Husband and father Leslie Gelberger died after he was struck by a pilot boat when swimming off North Shore in 2017.

item.title: Kurdish-Iranian author Behrouz Boochani given refugee status in New Zealand
item.description: Immigration New Zealand has confirmed that Behrouz Boochani has been given refugee status in New Zealand.

item.title: One new case of Covid-19 in managed isolation
item.description: There has been one new case of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand after two days of no new cases, the Health Ministry has confirmed.

item.title: Some flooded Northlanders homes unliveable for months
item.description: Some Northland residents affected by last week's flooding may have to wait six months until they can move back into their home.

item.title: Dedicated nurses should be used in managed isolation facilities - union
item.description: Nurses should not be working in managed isolation and quarantine facilities as well as hospitals and aged care facilities, the Nurses Society says.
